intro: Cheilanthes dalhousieae, commonly known as the Dalhousie's rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows on rocky outcrops and in dry, shaded environments. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome with a dense cluster of small, fleshy, ovate leaves. Its fronds are usually leathery and have a distinctive, compact appearance. This species is native to parts of Asia, including India, and is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions.
